Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= the unspoken content of one's own thinking and reasoning
literally: (one's) going and (one's) lying down; hence: = all activities that one is involved in
= action by which humans assume a horizontal position
= a process by which humans obtain knowledge about something ◄ by mentally winnowing it, in order to find out what is good and what is bad
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= causative action by which deities keep humans safe by surrounding them on all sides

Node.gloss: to lay (one's) hand > to impose (one's) authority (on someone)
Node.definition: literally: to lay (one's) hand (on someone); hence: = action by which deities impose their authority on humans
= the inner part of the human hand (יָד) but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= causative action by which humans spread out a cloth on the floor or a bed with the intention of sleeping on top of it

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
literally: to lift up (one's) wings; hence: = action by which birds or other flying creatures raise their wings in order to fly away

= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection|= part where converging sides or edges of an object meet; ≈ sometimes associated with the far side of an object

= pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= causative action by which darkness covers an object ► so that it is no longer visible
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

= process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

Node.gloss: to be light|to become light|to shine
Node.definition: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well being

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, and fear

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= causative action by which deities call humans or objects into existence

= either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals|literally: kidney; hence: = seat of a person's emotions and devotion to God, created by God, and hidden to everyone but God himself
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= state in which humans, deities, places and activities have qualities that inspire fear in others

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which humans are unaware of certain information
= the framework of bones supporting the human body
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= state in which people, animals, or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= causative action by which someone creates beautiful cloth by sewing decorative patterns into it

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
exact meaning unsure; probably: = an unborn child, possibly described as something that is rolled up and about to unfold

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact|literally: to form; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a certain pattern of events to take place, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: precious; hence: = state in which a condition or activity is highly appreciated or considered of high significance
= the unspoken content of one's own thinking and reasoning
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which events happen with a large frequency
literally: head; hence: = the total number of a range of events
= action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons or objects

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

Node.gloss: if only ... (I would be so happy!)
Node.definition: = particle marking an event that one wishes to happen
= causative action by which humans or deities cause people to die
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
possibly Israelite Hebrew and Aramaic; = person that is one's opponent in daily life or in battle; ≈ associated with causing people anguish and distress
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= to experience a deep loathing for a person or condition
hatred (between siblings)
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which the mind of humans is filled with distressing thoughts

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state of being subjected to difficult circumstances, dominated by physical pain
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
